text: Sample from a 0.75l bottle @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. The legend. This one pours a mild blurry golden colored body with a small quickly sidesticking white head in the top. Nice, but not too extreme nose. A bit surprised by that actually. Still, its soft wood sour with green currants and a little quite suiting white vine. Theres also this nice sweetness in the blend - like a peachy sweetness. Nice, but as mentioned a little milder than I thought. Oh, its sour and sharp in the taste! Really stingy and wild. Makes up for the arome. Almost like sour heather with honey and a rush of lemon juices. White currant sour, a little gooseberry freshness in the finish. Really fruity and superb refreshing. Nice stuff! 13.05.2016
A whole lot of apricot. Its juicy and tart and crisp and really drinkable. I liked this beer a lot but I doubt I could give up what my friend did to try it again.
Bottle at CBC 2016. Hazy golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of apricot, wood, barnyard, lemon, citrus and sourness.
Aroma of apricot, peach, white wine, lemon. Very clean. Taste of apricot^2, barnyard, hay, lemon. Best apricot sour Ive had, quite clean but nice and citrusy.

Draught. Golden coluored. Hazy. Off white small head. ARoma. Sourness, barnyard, easrth, some fruits, yeast. Flavour. Citrus, sourness, barnyard, earth, yeast, fruits, Medium to full bodied. Ends sour and acidic. Very nice and refreshing.

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity sour tart spicy apricot woody aroma. Fruity malty spicy sour tart woody apricot flavor. Has a fruity sour tart woody apricot finish.

Från flaska på CBC-2016. Smak och doft av jäst, citrus, krusbär, rabarber, omogna vinbär, physalis med toner av trä. Syrlig och fruktig, fyllig, rena fina smaker i riktigt fin kombination, bra karaktär. Riktigt bra!
One of the top five beers Ive ever had. Tons of apricots, very smooth, and well balanced.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2016 (Blue session). Hazy yellow colour, small white head. Aroma is fruity, citrusy, some sour wood and mild earthy notes. Flavour is quite similar, but has a nice tart woodenness to it. Dry and pleasant palate.

(750ml bottle) clear medium gold, fine white bubbles. Nose of huge apricot, sweetish, lacto, bugs, barrel, touch pedio and yogurt. Taste of sweet apricot, lacto, real apricot, delicious and so fruity.
Bottle. Pours deep orange with a small white head. Aromas of juicy apricots, vinous, tart, lactic, light brett and funk, citrus, lemon. Taste has apricots, brett, funk, vinous, lactic, dry.

2015 batch bottle shared by a friend. side by side with west ashley. poured a beautiful murky hazed golden colour with a lasting white head on top. while our batch of west ashely poured with thick orange chuncks of apricot (even smelled more fruited). nose is way more delicate, funky barnyard, lots of oak, juicy farmhouse apricots, lactic sour apricots, vinous wine barrel notes, minerals, grains, light lemons, very clean and bright. taste is chewy with lots of minerals. perfect balanced without getting to sour. clean creamy mouthfeel. again so clean delicious and delicate. layers of different barrel flavours. one of my favourite breweries for this year. what a masterpiece again!

Bottle @ CBC 2016. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of light sourness, yeast, little brett, barnyard, tart fruit, apricot. Flavor is light sour, yeasty, brett, barn, wood, tart fruity, peach ad apricot. Medium body, average carbonation, fruity acidic finish. 130516
Sample @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Clear yellow body with a small white head. Floral, light yeasty, apricots, fruity, tart, funky, tart. Lovely.
On tap @ CBC-16. Cloudy yellow with a tiny white head. Fruity and vinous tones. Fruit, wood, sour and bitterness.Medium to full body with a long bitter / sour finish.

Bottle 750ml @ CBC 2016, Blue session, København
Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, funk, citrus, hine of winegum and dried fruits. Taste is medium sweet and medium sour with a long slightly dry, light tart, citrus and apricot finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Enjoyed @ CBC. Pours hazy pale golden with a tiny white head. Aroma is slightly mineral, apricots, peach, orange, citrus, oak and light funk. Taste is medium sour and light bitter. Thin but slightly oily texture. Finish is oak, citrus and dry.
CBC. Unclear yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, baking yeast, sour, lacto and funk. Flavour is malt, sour, baking yeast, funk, little dry, acid, medium sweet, hop and a little bitter.
CBC. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity and barnyard. Flavor is quite sweet and rather acidic. Dry and rather acidic finish. 130516

Tap @ CBC. Pours hazy dark yellow with a white head. Aroma of stone fruits, apricots, oak, nectarine, orange, funk, lactic tartness, peaches and citrus. Amazing aroma! The taste is juicy with lots of stone fruits, candy, tart lactic notes, deep oaky notes, lemon and a dry sour end. Awesome beer.

From 750 ml bottle at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016 - Blue session. Unclear golden color with white to off white head. Yeasty fruity aroma, stone fruits, funky, dusty, barnyard notes, wood. Sweet and acidic funky fruity taste like aroma. Medium thin to oily body with soft carbonation.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Beer Celebration 2016, Copenhagen - pours gold with a white head. Sour fruity aroma and taste with resonating apricot which really stands out, light floral, medium acidic, grape, nice wooden nuance on the palate.

750mL bottle, pours a hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma brings out huge apricot notes upfront, with light tartness and even lighter acidity. Flavour is intense on the apricots - hard to get anything but. Light tartness and gentle acidity. Not hugely complex, but quite elegant and easy to drink. Like apricot sour candy almost with low sweetness. Excellent.

Från flaska på CBC-16. Syrlig och fruktig doft. Doft och smak av rabarber, omogna bär, krusbär, trä, funk, relativt syrlig men i bakgrunden finns en växande sötma med lite sötare frukter aprikos, physalis. Så snygg och välbalanserad, så mycket karaktär. Fantastiskt gott.

Bottle at Dangerous bottleshares 20th edition!! Featuring Zakoon and Aaron. (Also had it on tap at CBC but this rating probably does give this beer the rating it deserves), Cloudy yellow pour with a fizzy head. Tons of stone fruits, light citric, fizzy, funk, red apples, apricots and a long juicy finish.

Sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Slight hazy golden shade. Ring of white head. Bright fruity taste with apricot and white grape. Like the fruit character a lot. Quite a dry taste. Good stuff but difficult for me to see why its rated so highly.
Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration, 2016. Pours Hazy golden with a white head. Fruity and fresh aroma and flavor with notes of Wood, apricot and funk. Dry finish.

Bottle at Dangerous bottleshares 20th edition!! Featuring Zakoon and Aaron. Had this one at CBC as well, so this is a mixed rating. Pours a deep, murky orangy yellow with a nice, white head. Aroma has tons of stone fruits, lots of funk, juicy apricot, dry, oaky, light lactic. Much more fruity than at CBC. Taste is super sour, much more sour than i recall west ashley. Long, juicy, funky, oaky aftertaste. Average carbonation and a very dry body with some juicyness. Rated this 8/4/8/4/16 at CBC, but turning it up a notch.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ blue. Yellow golsen hazy. Nkce tart dry fruity nose. Farmy, tart intense bodied, slight yeasty doughy finish. Real intense tho.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
On tap at CBC 2016. Pale golden with a thin white head. Apricot, brett, some citrus and fruit sourness.

On tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Yellow with a pale head. Aroma is apricot, oak, dried peach, dried pear. Light bodied, lightly sticky mouthfeel, fruity and sour on the palate with a dry, slightly acidic warming finish. Taste is apricot, sour stone fruit.

Bottle at CBC 16. Very hazy orange with a ring white head. Huge apricot aroma upfront, with light funk, light dusty notes, vinous aspects and a little oak. Flavour is light sweet and above moderate sour. Medium bodied with light carbonation.
Bottle @CBC16. Hazy yellow, small white head. Acetic, citric aroma. Berries and apricot. Funky, sour lemon flavour, fruity. Tart and dry.

Bottle at CBC 2016. Hazy golden with white head. Strong apricot aroma with slight funk, oak, grapes and black pepper. Balanced fruity taste with apricot, grapes, oak, slight pepper. Crisp, tart and dry. Lovely!

Sample at CBC 2016. 

A bit hazy golden with a white head. A solid and nicely drinkable one with grapefruit, apricot, some grass and funk. The body was medium and the finish dry. Great!

Backlog from Copenhagen Beer Celebration, Blue pass 2016-05-13 
Beautyful beer... So well balanced and such great flavours to it... I love it!

Sample from bottle at CBC 2016, Blue session. Hazy, golden colour with a medium sized, creamy, white head. Fruity aroma with berries, apricot, yeasts, oak, citrus and floral notes. Taste is sour. Medium to full body. Finishes dry and fruity-bitter. Excellent.

Blue session, Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Clear pale golden beer with a small offwhite head. Sourish vinous aroma, grapefruit, perfume, grapes, floral notes, some lemongrass. Sourish vinous flavor, woody, citrus, perfume notes, grapes, floral, some raisins. Wonderful beer.

Bottle at CBC 16 Blue Session. Pours a clearish golden with a white head. Dry and tart with aromas of berries. Hints of abricots. Also notes of black pepper. Medium to light bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry and tart finish.
Keg. Hazy yellow, medium sized white head. Peach, apricot, light/medium sour, dust, fruit skin, hay, light wood and barnyard. Crisp and fresh.
CBC 2016. Pours golden with a low white head. Aromas of funk, citrus, apricot, green apples. Taste is funky and fruity. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation and very dry.

Pours hazy apricot with low white head 
Aromas of tart grapes, apricot, citrusy fruits, 
Taste has notes of tart grapes, hints of apricot, over ripe green apples, garden leaves
Pours cloudy golden with flat head. Aroma of grass, green grapes, apples. Taste is rich sour tart with a mellow fruit sweet finish. Light and sticky body with average carbonation.
Tap cbc. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of sweet apricot, tart, funk, barn, complex, fruity. Taste us tarty and fruity. Very nice
On tap at CBC. Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Fruity, herbal and slightly yeasty flavour with a floral touch. Dry and tart fruity flavour.

13.05.2016, 0,75l bottle @ CBC:
Small slightly bubbly shortlasting head. Aroma is mild sour-ish, sorrel, unripe berries, oak, grass, minerals, hints of booze. Taste is sour-ish dry, sorrel, unripe berries, vinegar, raw rhubarb, oak, minerals gooseberries. Medium bitterness, acidic dry mouthfeel. Nice.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2016 750ml bottle @ CBC 2016, Copenhagen. Pours yellowish golden with a small head. Aroma of tartish lemon, citrus, sourish yeast, earthy notes and hints of farmyard. Taste is smooth, slightly tart and sourish with some citrus, lemon and hops. Finish is sourish, fruity and tart with some funky yeastiness. Refreshing and balanced.
Bottle @ CBC 2016. Pours clear golden with a thin white head. Floral, tart nose, hay in aroma. Flavor has tartness, hint of vinegar, dried fruits. Mouthdrying, complex.
A golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of funk and lemons. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, straw, and funk, leading to a dry finish.
Sample from bottle at CBC2016, Copenhagen. Colour is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, sourness, citrus and some sweetness.
75 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is citrusy and mellow barnyard. Smooth fruity, lingering citrusy and bretty, barnyard. Smooth fruity finish.
On tap at RateBeer Best 2016. Pour is translucent golden/orange with an average-sized white head. Flavor and aroma of peach, apricot, mango, oak chips, lemon, and a touch of acidity.

Bottle @ RateBeer Best 2016. A later pour from the bottle, so a little bit chunky, but fine with me. Intense apricot and just overall juicy fruity quality to both the aroma and flavor. Pleasant lemon and citric acidity here without being over the top. Notes of lime, grape skin, and oak to go along with all the apricot. Really nice.

Pour from a 750 ml bottle at RB Best. Pours a hazy orange with a white head that lasts as a little cap all the way down. I havent tried West Ashley, so I have no basis for comparison, but if this is an amping-up of the apricot, it shows. Loads of it in here, with wet straw, barnyard funk, melon, lemon, oak, cheesecloth, and peach. Light-medium bodied, with medium carbonation and a tart, funky mouthfeel. I appreciated this more over time, as I sampled other world-class sours at the fest. Excellent stuff.

Bottle at ratebeer best festival. pours out a hazy gold topped with a small white head. nose is stone fruit funky tart wood along with some tangerine citrus notes. taste is more of the stone fruit funky pucker some wood and the citrus touch.

Bottle at RateBeer Best 2016. Pours mostly clear gold with a creamy, white head. The nose holds tangerine, light wood, a little funk. Light sweet flavour with pleasantly drying wood, some lemony acidity, tangy apricots, tangerines. Light bodied with average carbonation. Tart and dry to finish. Excellent stuff.
[1/31/16] Draught sample at RateBeer Best festival in Santa Rosa. Cloudy shiny yellow. Funk, fruitiness, lots of oak, sweat. Tart, dry, crisp. Great.

Keg at RB Best Festival, 31/01/16.
Hazed orange with a well appointed off white covering. 
Nose is pissy citrics, funk, damp hay, wood must, on the turn melon, tangerine. 
Taste comprises sharp citric peel, lemon rind, farmyard, funky, tarte apricot, wood must. 
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a light acidic rise. 
Decent sour.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Tap at the Rate Beer Awards Festival. Very tart grapefruit flavor, horse blanket. Sour, quite lambic-like, apricots, grapefruit, horse blanket funk.

Bottle at RateBeer Best. It pours a deep orange color with a fizzy head. The aroma has big fruity notes of ripe apricots, some minerals. The flavor is a bit more funky than the aroma, but is still very fruit forward with tons of sweet/tart apricot. The higher boost is noticed. A little biting in the finish. Very enjoyable, but I like West Ashley a lot more.

Pour @ RateBeer Best Festival. Cloudy orange appearance with an off white head. Aroma is bursting with stone fruit (apricots, peaches), vanilla, some acid, oak, and a bit of lemon. Quite sour. Medium light body. The fruit is extremely potent and rich in the mouth which is enjoyable but it was a bit too acidic for me. Its an enjoyable apricot beer and very tasty but it lacks the complexity of Side Project Fuzzy or Casey Leaner. Glad I got to try this.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2016 Sample from bottle at RateBeer Best. Light hazy deep orange liquid with medium white head. Aroma of wood, lemon peel, light apple skin, light grain and mineral. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of lemons, wood and light mineral. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Great, if a bit over hyped.

Bottle shared at the the rbwg 2016. Bright golden orange coloured pour with a thin lastkng white head. Aroma is funky, juicy, peach apricot, smoked hop, lemon. Flavour is composed of tangy apricot. Peach. Mango. Smoke, sour lemon.
Taster from bottle at Ratebeer Fest. Pours a golden color with a bit of head. Intense dried apricot flavor and nice tartness.

Bottle at RBWG 2016. A ton of fruit and juicy sensation. Hazy pale yellow with soft white head. Taste is a pure juicy pleasure. Light hay and a crisp finish. Moderate fuzzy sensation comes through as it warms. Amazing.

750 ml bottle to taster. Looks good; a cloudy orangish apricot with thin eggshell head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells good too; tart and funky with loads of apricot alongside a nice oak presence. Tastes like it smells with a nice brett presence. Mouthfeel is medium full-bodied and pleasantly tart. Chewy like OJ. Delicious!

750ml bottle in a tulip on my 30th. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of apricots, some light sour/tartness, pale malts, more light fruits, and some lightt oak/wine. Flavor the same with an incredible amount of apricots that goes perfectly with the sour beer. A great beer.

Bottle care of Frank Daddy. Pours clearish golden, with small head. Sticky turkey, cranberry slices, ultra tart apricot, vino, lemon and oak. Light to medium body. The pink turkey cranberry flavor faded and got more apricot skinned out with some barn and lemon skin funk. Lots of acidity but not offensive like a de garde. Glad I was able to try this one.

Wow imimpressed here. Peach golden color with fluffy white head. Aroma is juicy apricots light vinous grapes, a touch of vanilla, lemony acidity. Taste is perfect tartness blend with juicy apricot fruits.
750ml bottle. Golden pour, definitely smells like peaches or apricots, bit of oxidization but mostly nice tartness and fruitiness. Non-abrasive.
Smells like melon and tart stone fruit. Mostly clear golden with thin tiny bubble white head. Think acidicly fizzy attacks your nose but mellowed so round and smooth like a fresh apricot.

Bottle... This beer rocks! Pours cloudy and yellow with a tiny, creamy, white head. The aroma features a truckload of apricots accompanied by lightly funky woodiness, white wine and lactic acidity. Full-bodied and silky with airy carbonation. The flavor is sour, fruity, yeasty and mildly vinous. Finishes super-fruity with a light splash of white wine vinegar. Muchos kudos to landhoney for providing this bottle of world-class beer!

Huge thanks to Kevin for bringing this one to Imminent Liquidation V. Pours murky orange-ish yellow with a one finger tall white head, quickly dissipating down to a light film, leaving small streaks of lace on the sides of the glass.


Smell is amazing. Loads of apricots, woody oak, musty basement and barnyard funkiness, some other nondescript tropical fruit, earthen mineral and some doughy malt. Taste is just as good with tons of fresh fruit up front quickly being joined by the funkiness and finally the other supporting flavors. Smooth, fruity/sour feel from start to finish. Definitely a bit bigger feel than the regular West Ashley but it is still very easy drinking. 


Overall this is one of the best fruited saison/sours I have ever had. I love West Ashley but this takes it to a whole other level. I cant thank Kevin enough for opening this one for us all to try, cheers buddy!

Bottle (750 ml). From Jake/Chris, thanks!

Appearance: Hazy golden with a small white head and little lacing. 

Aroma: A burst of apricots and oak, which is really interesting, but not much to support it. Theres some brettanomyces as well as some oak spiciness and subdued winey notes. 

Taste: Taste is quite acidic with a lot of jammy apricots and a ton of oak. Theres also some oak spiciness, winey notes, brettanomyces and light herbal presence.

Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Oaky mouthfeel. Moderately dry finish. Lingering apricots aftertaste. 

Overall: Its a very good beer, but it lacks of finesse. Its definitely fruitier and more oaky than West Ashley, but that doesnt make it much better. Really nice fruitiness and interesting oak features, but lack a bit of balance. A bit disappointing considering its often considered Sante Adairius most wanted beers, but they make other beers much better than this one. Still tasty though. It was delicous mixed with Heady Topper (1 part of Westly for 3 parts of Heady).

bottle shared by tom10101, thanks bro! pours hazy light golden with a small creamy reviving white head leaving nice lacing. fruity apricots  not an explosion; other pale orchard fruitiness, zesty oranges, spices, light acidity - nice and complex microflora, gently oaked, pepper and herbs. light carbonation, light body  oily; dry, tart and fruity-spicy finish. an upgrade from west ashley but not necessarily spectacular either.

Thanks to Tommy for sharing this whale with us. Pours a really hazy golden with no head and no lacing. Nose is of fruits and pretty intense acetic acid. Taste is of fruits (apricots) and massively acidic and puckering. Body is medium, carbonation light to moderate. Overall it was good but unrefined. A little less enjoyable than West Ashley, even. I wouldnt ask for it again but Im
pleased that we got to try it.

Bottle. Hazy gold pour with thin white head. Aroma of apricot, nice and fruity, funky Saison, really nice winey bretty aroma. Taste is doughy, tons of tart apricot, apricot jam, lemony notes. Palate is med-light bodied nice carbonation. Really nice.
Rating #4400. Bottle. Golden hazy pour with tan head. Super sweet peach aromas. Peach, tart, funk and sour tones; super juicy and sweet.

Huge thanks to yourefragile for the share. Served alongside West Ashley. Pale yellow body with a thin, broken head. Lovely aroma. Fruit and funk. Stone fruit, melon, tropical notes, oranges, apricots. Oh my...what a flavor. West Ashley was phenomenal and this somehow takes it up another notch. White wine and oak character emerges, adding depth and complexity. A thicker, richer body with a glimpse of an acetic note in the finish. Lingering fruit and tannins. World class.

Rating #2200! Poured into a Duvel tulip. Nice shimmering golden orange with a firm white head, good retention, slowly fading into a persistent filmy ring. Aroma is predictably very strong with the dried apricot, reminiscent of West Ashley but different -- somehow funkier (eggy and sharp) with a touch of medjool date sweetness. Flavor is quite juicy, dried apricots and white wine (some sips sauv blanc, some sips champagne), expiration-date greek yogurt, beautifully integrated oaky finish (not tannic or buttery), a lingering pang of acid, a bit acetic but restrained in that aspect, lactic and cheesy in general. Long, dry finish. Life is an apricot.
Bottle generously shared by Seth. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Sour apricot aromas. Big sour apricot notes dominate. Super sour but still damn tasty. Good body and mouthfeel.
Pours hazy golden yellow. Light smells of apricot. Rich apricot taste, light sourness, a little salty and damn good!

The beer is a bright, glowy gold. Yellowish orange. Nice foamy head. Lots of lacing. Big apricot aroma. Sweet and fruity. Really not a lot else gets through besides the fruit. Mild to medium tart taste. Lots more fruit flavor. Sort of a heavier feel. Just a ton of fruit. Great beer, but the higher abv doesnt really work for me. Still very tasty and interesting to try West Ashley amped up.

Cloudy orange color, small white head. Juicy apricots hit up front and linger throughout the sip. Quite tart but not abrasively sour. Tons of vibrant stone fruit. A tad hint of yeast. I think I liked this more than west Ashley, barely.

Draft. Amber beer with a cream head. Tart and apricot pie aroma. Acetic notes and sour flavor with light apricots. Medium bodied. Sour and acetic notes linger with apricot, light lemon, and light oak.

Bomber. Gonna throw this one off the hype train before it leaves California. Kinda smells like burnt hair and perm solution in my grandmas beauty shop. Taste is fruit and a bit of sour with some harsh acidity. Had this in a tasting with 13 awesome sours and it was at the bottom of the list.

Bottle thanks to Chow, Russell, and Rainer. Pours a cloudy orange with medium frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is apricot flesh, oak, apricot pits. Thick mouth with strong apricot juice, lingering apricot flavor, so juicy, wow really enjoyed this.

A few bottles, and on draft at Good Karma, such an honor! Aroma is explosive apricot flesh, pits, dried apricot, some lime, yogurt, lots of acid and an ever-so-slight- waxy/plastic phenol on the exhale. Musty funk and oak is present to keep the beer in balance from a juice bomb. The beer pours cloudy golden with some chunks and a big fluffy white head that sticks around for a bit. Taste up front is apricot pith, some white wine, harsh sourness, lots of citrus, lemon, lime, more waxy dried apricot. The body is thick, creamy with medium carbonation and sour finish. The after taste is citrus, peach and apricot skin funk and oak. Wowzers so many layers. The first bottle I opened was definitely the most fruit forward, while the sourness really came out on draft. The second bottle had a better balance of the two extremes and definitely more West Ashley like. Great beer to track the changes, I would think that fresh is best however.

At the Bistro Barrel Fest, this poured a hazy orange - melon hue with a thin cream colored head. The nose was tart and moderate apricot with some funk. The first and lasting impression is acidic and tartness. Not much of anything else, possibly because the acidic characteristic is just too overwhelming.
UPDATED: MAY 25, 2015 Bottle. Thanks Jake and Nick. Pours orange gold white head. Nose/taste of super fresh apricot, oak, wine and tart acid. Medium body.

Aroma is very fruity with a lot of apricot character. Light acidity and citrus character. Light oak notes. Aroma is mostly dominated by apricot. 
Pours a cloudy orange with a medium sized, fairly thick white head that recedes quickly to the edges. Moderately high lacing and small legs. Some chunks at the bottom of the glass. 
Flavor is lightly acidic with some medium light oak notes and light tannins. Medium bitterness and slightly hard water. Lots of apricot character with some light citrus notes and a bit of peach and pear. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a really nice, very apricot forward beer. Some light oak barrel character and acidity compliments the apricots. Not much base beer character.

3500TH TICK AND THIS IS A RARE TICK OMG HELL YES THIS IS GONNA BE AAAWWWWWEEEESSSSOOOOMMME I know from the bottle count and trade value. Hazy orange color with a white head and nice swirls. Excellent sour apricot aroma with funk and a touch of vinegar. The flavor is lactic and slightly acetic. Loads of sour apricot - great fruit flavor. Medium-bodied and bitingly sour with lively carbonation. Great beer! Not surprised given its so rare, but still.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2014 [ Bottle ][ ½ of 75cl ][ Tasting ][ Trade ][ Tulip ][ 9.27.14 ]Murky peach pour, lasting white head, larger bubbled with good lacing. Stinky peach is softer than Ashley, flesh is very fruity, bright before light paint thinner, a little lotion but sweetness and acidity very well balanced. Ultra bright profile, balanced moderate sweetness and acidity, tons pf peach flesh, no skin bitterness, mid tingling jowls with highly fizzy moderate body, lightly papery finish has tons of peach, high acidity, bright stinging carbonation in mouth contrasting the burn in the chest, the peach very well rounded. Some rough patches but the peach is fully expressive. Very limited off notes and exceptional body, nuance boosted by the lively, ultra-small bubbles.  [ 9.27 Tasting Ranking ]  01. Pour is a deep golden amber with tons of very tight white head that sits forever. Nose is very dusty up front, faint touch of cheese, nice fresh very ripe apricot. Taste is similar, bright peach and apricot, dusty brett balances and integrated gently, moderately sour, not acetic, gentle bitterness in the finish. Lighter body, fairly soft feel, assertive carb and fairly dry.

Mmm apricots in the face! A - this pours a nice glowing apricot with 1 finger of white head and strong sticky lacing. S - strong pretty interesting nose. Dried apricots and apricot jam come on strong. Very musty and white winey. Strong barrel character with some vinegar, Sauvignon blanc grapes. Crackery malts and lemon juice. The nose is so powerful and almost a chemical tone. M - full thick body. Nice blend of maltiness and sour. Thinner end. Nice balance and full palate. T - now this is where Westly really shines. So! much! apricot! Those soft Dried apricots and sweet apricot preserves with a touch of lemon juice lead into that fantastic Sante yeast and house bugs. The palate is malty goodness, nice barrel character, buttery and citrusy white wine character. The end has a touch of dill pickle juice. Very very fruity. O - a fantastic showing from Sante. A nice take on west ashley.

Yay, first rating! Bottle shared among friends. Pours cloudy golden amber, lots of chunks. Small off-white head that dissipates leaving good lacing. Aroma is mega apricot, flesh, skins, pits, everything, touched by a bit of musty basement funk. Flavor is apricot with a capital "A" medium sour and super fruity, with just a light touch of funkiness. Lots of apricot skin flavors. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Tasty.
